TERA Observation(s) in 2010: West approach slope appears unstable on construction right-of-way.
TERA Observation(s) in 2011: Area of poor vegetation establishment on west bank observed on construction right-of-way during ground reconnaissance.
TERA Observation(s) in 2012: Bare patch (2 m x 2 m) on west bank observed on construction right-of-way during ground reconnaissance.
TERA Observation(s) in 2013: Vegetation now well-established on the west bank.
Repairs to Date (2010 to 2013): Slopes repaired, protected and reseeded in fall 2011. Repaired with topsoil and jute matting, reseeded in October 2012.

Environmental Issue(s): Land and Resource  Use - Urban Construction Area Vegetation - Weeds
TERA Observation(s) in 2010: Moderate to high density of nodding thistle, dandelion, green foxtail, Canada thistle, perennial sow-thistle and foxtail barley on construction right-of-way.
TERA Observation(s) in 2011: Moderate density of Canada thistle, perennial sow-thistle and narrow-leaved hawk's-beard observed on construction right-of-way during ground reconnaissance.
TERA Observation(s) in 2012: Low to moderate densities of Canada thistle and perennial sow-thistle observed on construction right-of-way during ground reconnaissance.
TERA Observation(s) in 2013: Perennial sow-thistle observed at higher densities on the construction right-of-way compared to off.
Recommended Measure(s) to Resolve Issue(: Control weeds, if warranted, and monitor in 2014.

TERA Observation(s) in 2011: Poor drainage observed on construction right-of-way during ground reconnaissance. Landowner concerned with excess seepage on construction right-of-way due to construction resulting in greater than normal soft areas and wetness.
TERA Observation(s) in 2012: Poor drainage observed on construction right-of-way during ground reconnaissance.
TERA Observation(s) in 2013: Issue assessed by a third party.
Recommended Measure(s) to Resolve Issue(: Issue being managed by a third-party company.

TERA Observation(s) in 2011: Moderate compaction observed on construction right-of-way by landowner.
TERA Observation(s) in 2012: Moderate compaction observed on construction right-of-way during ground reconnaissance.
TERA Observation(s) in 2013: No issues with hay crop observed in 2013. Vegetation well-established.
